pullRequest.title: Fix flaky test: executeTransactionAwait
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #7136

Made executeTransactionAwait cooperative (although it won't cancel the transaction itself)
Fixed bogus test so that it blocks until the coroutine job is cancelled with cancelAndJoin
Added tests with heavy transactions that explore cooperation for cancellation
Added and fixed some documentation

commit.message: Made executeTransactionAwait cooperative (although it won't cancel the transaction itself), fixed test so that it blocks until the coroutine job is cancelled, added two more tests with heavy transactions that explore cooperation for cancellation, added and fixed some documentation
Improved clarification on cooperation in executeTransactionAwait method documentation

nodes.bodyText: I see a Realm.close() in the setUp but there is no tearDown step, couldn't it leave an open instance after the last test execution?
This doesn't actually do anything. Realm.getInstance() will increment the reference count and then close it again. But any other underlying Realms will not be closed.
Maybe wrap the underlying block in use instead of manually closing, because close will not be called if the awaitOrFails throws
Ah, nice. Didn't know this was possible 👍
